file_content.text: I take it you've heard about Ziost.
I saw it for myself.
It was a blur. We tried to evacuate as many as we could. Considering so much was out of control, I'd say we did all right...
...but Vitiate is stronger now. Sith Intelligence is in complete disarray. It's all coming apart.
We will endure.
Don't be hard on yourself.
You messed up.
It's a setback to be sure, but this isn't over. Not even close.
Things are bad, no doubt about it. That doesn't mean it's over.
The weight of the Empire doesn't rest on your shoulders alone, Lana.
Beating yourself up over it won't change anything, Lana.
I have to learn from this, from my mistakes--but I don't intend to wallow, if that's your concern.
This was a test of your leadership. You failed.
This was one of those "defining moments." You didn't do so great.
I don't think that's entirely fair.
The Republic army, those Jedi--they wouldn't have been there if it wasn't for your "most promising aide."
I was blind. So blind.
When Darth Arkous first asked for my counsel, I considered turning him down. I wanted understanding, not a place in the power structure.
But that's where I am. I don't take the responsibility lightly. Whatever comes my way, I will deal with it.
I've seen what you're capable of. I know you won't disappoint.
I don't doubt it.
Thank you, my lord.
Thank you, hunter.
Thank you, Commander.
Especially after Ziost, putting an end to Vitiate's threat feels like an impossible task. I don't believe it truly is impossible. Even if it were, we have to try.
Is that optimism?
It would appear so. Imagine that.
Don't expect mercy from anyone if you fall short again.
You'd better this time....
Yes, my lord. I believe that's fair.
I won't, hunter--believe me.
Fair enough, Commander.
Well--the Republic are licking their wounds, same as us, but they aren't relenting. And they are hardly our only concern.
I suppose I should go about looking after the security of the Sith Empire. Unless there was anything else?
May the Force ever serve you.
No. Good luck.
And you.
It would be nice to know what you're planning.
What's next for Intelligence?
To rebuild Sith Intelligence, of course. I'm thinking mobile headquarters this time.
I'll see that anything crucial gets right to you, Commander.
Anything you need, Lana--anything at all....
[Flirt] I'm here for you.
Anything I need.
That will do--for now.
Be well, my love.
If you need me, I'll be around.
Go on. I've got your back.
I know.
May the Force ever serve you.
No, I don't think so.
You need to resign.
Excuse me?
Do everyone a favor and step down.
Yeah, I don't know. I'm thinking you and Sith Intelligence aren't the best match.
You should resign.
I haven't been flawless--I think I've admitted as much--but I can do this.
I've shown you--I've been showing you since Manaan. I had Theron Shan wrapped around my finger without so much as a mind trick.
I'm competent, I'm qualified--I can lead Sith Intelligence. What makes you think otherwise?
I've seen ministers come and go, and I've seen you under pressure. You can't hack it.
Experience.
Your performance on Ziost says it all. You can't hack it. You know I'm right.
You were a total mess.
I can't deny how overwhelmed I felt. I believe I did the best I could, but if you don't see it that way....
I'll have a talk with Darth Marr. I'll... offer my resignation.
Agent Kovach is a mole. He works for the Supreme Chancellor.
Kovach is a traitor.
I see. That's... inexcusable. That's completely inexcusable.
I'll offer my resignation to Darth Marr--right after I tend to a certain matter.
Your Agent Kovach was a Republic mole. That's why I killed him.
Kovach was a traitor.
I... I knew there had to be a reason for what you did. How could I have been so blind?
All right. I'll offer my resignation to Darth Marr.
Your favorite asset was a mole. You're not as competent as you seem to think.
Agent Kovach.
I try to look at everything objectively--with a pragmatic eye, no ego whatsoever....
You're right. I'm fooling myself. I'll... speak to Darth Marr. Offer my resignation.
I'm... not sure in what capacity I'll see you after this, but... as ever, may the Force serve you well.
I don't want to see the job destroy you, Lana.
[Flirt] I'm worried for you.
I won't let it. It really is as simple as that.
Your concern doesn't go unappreciated.
Were we able to get anywhere with the commander of the Sixth Line?
Anything from Surro?
It's not been fruitful so far, but our technicians have managed to keep Master Surro alive. We'll keep searching for a link.
I'm confident something will come of it. Thank you for trusting me.
